streamlink --output=tor.aac  --hls-audio-select=['*'] --hls-segment-timeout=60 --hls-timeout=600 --http-cookie='Authorization=eyJraWQiOiI5NDljZjE1ZS1mMTYwLTRlMzctYTRhOS1jYWMxYWFmMjk3ZWEiLCJhbGciOiJFZERTQSJ9..gyZHE_StdTkGZoOak0gu7BXl3C5MhTekePfHSmvx2Xesyn4prjoBrSo5Xq8yFAGpxDnnSpIYekSYIGA0xYabCQ' https://hlslive-ftc-ewr1.media.mlb.com/token=exp=1686898379~id=00u7myt0xldhlmej8356~data=e5124798-8f24-4a09-9c80-82d1be4b7b7d~hash=76f824445635422d7a76da9acaf5a245067fea49/va01/mlb/2023/06/14/Away_VIDEO_eng_Toronto_Blue_Jays_Baltimo_20230614_1686776734047/eng_48K/48_complete-trimmed.m3u8 worst

the above would get you the away audio feed ... either because the feed is the away feed, or worst=away ... to get this ...

start downloading the game as usual, but with -vvv to get full debug output
get the playlist of the game
top of that file (get it with wget) there is the URL to the audio feed (I guess always eng_48K/48_complete-trimmed.m3u8)
concat that to the base of the game URL
get the latest auth token from the above output
run the streamlink command ...

streamlink --output=game_audio.aac --hls-audio-select=['*'] --hls-segment-timeout=60 --hls-timeout=600 --http-cookie='Authorization=$authToken' $url worst/best
